Dear Mr. Lheureux:
Attached is the Renewal Inspection Report for the above referenced facility completed on
01/09/2023. Due to the violations, a written corrective action plan is required. It should
be noted that violations of any licensing statutes rules and are also violations of the
MISEP and your contract. The corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this
letter and must include the following:
• How compliance with each citation will be achieved.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
licensing statute and rule or section of the contract or MISEP citation.
• Specific time frames for each citation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, a regular license will be issued. If
you fail to submit an acceptable corrective action plan, disciplinary action will result.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager at (616) 204-6992.

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
1.) The facility is in compliance with all applicable rules and statutes except for the following:
CCI Rule 400.4113 Employee Records
An institution shall maintain employee records for each employee and
shall include documentation of all of the following information prior to
employment or at the time specified in this rule:
(i) Documentation from the Michigan department of human services, the
equivalent state or Canadian provincial agency, or equivalent agency in the
country where the person usually resides, that the person has not been
determined to be a perpetrator of child abuse or child neglect. The
documentation shall be completed not more than 30 days prior to the start of
employment and every 12 months thereafter.
Two out of thirty-one new employee files reviewed did not have the
documentation of verification the employee has not been determined to be a
perpetrator of child abuse or neglect as required within the 30 days prior to hire.
The two files did have the documentation completed but it was not within the 30-
d ay period.
CCI Rule 400.4156 Institutions not detention institutions or shelter care
institutions; updated treatment plan.
(2) The updated treatment plan developed by the social worker shall document
input from the resident, the resident’s parents, direct care staff, and the referral
source, unless documented as inappropriate.
One out of three open youth files reviewed did not have the youth's signature on
t he updated treatment plan.
2.) Any violation listed in section 1 is also an MISEP violation. Please note that there are
additional MISEP requirements that may not be included in section 1. The facility is in
compliance with all additional MISEP requirements.
3.) Any violation listed in section 1 is also a MDHHS Contract/Policy violation. Please
note that there are additional MDHHS Contract/Policy requirements that may not be
included in section 1. The facility is in compliance with all additional MDHHS
Contract/Policy requirements.

VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
The agency has submitted 1 acceptable corrective action plans not related to
maltreatment during this licensing period.
The facility had six special investigations during this period under review with one
resulting in a corrective action plan. The non-compliance was in regards to proper
staffing ratio. The facility's corrective action plan compliance is monitored quarterly
and no further issues have been identified.
Financial Overview
There are no financial concerns identified based on the review of the facility’s budget
and the agency’s financial audit.
PREA compliance (if applicable)
Not Applicable
Chief Administrator Assessment
Chief Administrator reported during the reporting period the facility has undergone a great
number of transitions with staff and have put into place a number of policies and
procedures. The Kentwood license has remained relatively stable with their full-time staff
and continue to hire for part time staff members. Chief Administrator reported since last
year, staffing ratios and retention have shown a significant trend of improvement. Chief
Administrator reported the six core strategies of BBI have been instrumental in the
changes occurring at the facility and these different concepts have driven changes with
hiring, interviewing, policies, programming and physical location. Over this past year the
Kentwood license has eliminated seclusion rooms and added a female mental health
stabilization program into their Riebel home. In this upcoming year, continued emphasis
will be on both the Associate Directors and Program Mangers presence in the units, team
meetings and leadership, as well as focus on coaching and developing therapists and
home supervisors. The Chief Administrator reported in the upcoming year he is confident
that staff at all levels will work together to maintain effective teams and best practices in
all areas of care.
2

Staff and Youth Interviews
Staff and youth interviews were conducted during the inspection and no issues or
concerns were raised. The youth all reported feeling safe and had positive relationships
with staff. The staff all reported feeling supported by direct supervisors as well as
administration.
Description of Agency Walk Through
An on-site inspection and walkthrough of the facility occurred on January 9, 2023.
There were no issues or safety concerns noted.
VII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable licensing
statutes and rules and/or MISEP requirements and/or contract/policy. Upon receipt of an
acceptable corrective action plan, it is recommended that the facility will be issued a
renewal of their regular license.
